title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=ae6b7a10fa3272821e9904431dab0b993b36aae7
comments: Incredibly excited to catch PS2 in the theater tomorrow. Did a bit of homework and rewatched PS1 in preparation, and it continues to stun. What a masterclass in acting, direction, and cinematography, with a fantastic interval block. Chola Supremacy!

1) Re-watched Aankhen after many years. The one with Amitabh, Akshay, Paresh, Arjun & Sushmita Sen. They have chopped off the original ending.

Old ending: Amitabh gets jailed. Akshay & Arjun survive, they find all the jewellery hidden in Paresh's harmonium & Sushmita's brother. They are shown sitting in the train and as the train starts Akshay's 6th sense tingles and we see Amitabh sneakily watching them from the platform. A few years later when YT boomed a deleted scene surfaced where Amitabh makes some deal with the police, gets the bank manager jailed which explains his escape from arrest.

New ending: Amitabh gets jailed. Akshay & Arjun survive, they find all the jewellery hidden in Paresh's harmonium & Sushmita's brother.

I think they are trying to adjust the new end to accommodate the sequel.

Fun fact: The writer of Sarabhai vs Sarabhai & Aankhen is the same person, Aatish Kapadia.

2) Re-watched XMen Apocalypse. I think we treated this movie too harshly for its time. Looking at the sad state in which the MCU is currently, this movie was very nice. It had action scenes at proper intervals. Expositions were actually interesting and well paced. The villain was a pure villain with no sad back story or redeeming factors. Violence was nice, Apocalypse beheads three people in a row with Sand, Magneto kills policemen with the locket, Apocalypse's horseman in the start literally folds a person to kill him, Apocalypse burying people alive in the wall.

This current MCU barely shows any killings, most villains are just someone wronged, lack of action scenes, expositions serve the purpose of promoting the next release rather than anything interesting, characters and actors are starting to become bland over time.

3) Started watching Parks & Rec, yes it was long due finally started it. I remembered it after TLOU E3 starring Nick Offerman. I knew Parks & Rec because of Nick Offerman's memes and somewhat because of Aubrey Plaza being in it. After watching it what an amazing show. Came for Nick Offerman, started liking Aziz Ansari, Amy Poehler, Adam Scott.
Started watching chainsawman. I'm not a big anime buff. Recently watched Jujustu Kaisen and it's movie JJK 0. It was awesome.
'Dancing on the grave' on Amazon prime. Bone chilling documentary on heinous crime by a Fake swami. Must watch.
Saw a little Indie movie called Polite Society. Cliche but still a fun movie. It sort of made my dream come true. I watched a movie alone in theatres. I sat in recliner seats without paying for it.
